headline: Intuit Options Activity Signals Potential Bullish Reversal
summary: Intuit’s options volume on Thursday was the highest in 24 months. As a result, its unusual options activity was also on fire with two in the top five. The action points to a potential bottom. Aggressive investors take note.

headline: Vibe-Coding in Gas Town? A Guide to the Software Selloff With 4 Sexy Stock Picks.
summary: Two things to know about the selloff in software stocks.  The second thing to know is that the software crash is definitely over, but also has further to go, judging by Wall Street analysis.  UBS warns “uncertainty could linger,” but the cause is fear of artificial-intelligence disruption, which validates AI’s moneymaking potential, which “ultimately should benefit both the intelligence and application layers” of software.

headline: From software to real estate, U.S. sectors under the grip of AI scare trade
summary: Wall Street is in the grip of disruption worries from AI. It first started with investors dumping shares of software companies but soon spread to sectors seen as vulnerable to automation, driving sharp losses in U.S. stocks this week. The AI scare trade did not spare even sectors ‌such as private credit, real estate brokers, data analytics, legal services and insurers.

headline: Mizuho Trims Target Price on Affirm (AFRM) to $95
summary: Affirm Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ:AFRM) is one of the 13 High-Risk High-Reward Growth Stocks to Invest In. On February 9, Mizuho reduced its target price on Affirm Holdings by 16.7% to $95 (from $114) while keeping an Outperform call on the stock. Dan Dolev, the analyst from Mizuho, views the recent selloff in AFRM as unjustified. […]
